Overwatch 2, forced use of third party registration when ported to steam.

No I don't want to make a Battlenet account.

Defeats the entire purpose of bringing the game to steam when you still require the third party account.

Also the game is a solid 'meh'. I never got the hype around it.

yeah OW1 was better cuz there was no Battle pass, no paid PvE, u could get free loot boxes etc. I'd rather spend 20â‚¬ and be able to get free cosmetics than play for free and pay for skins, but still, I dunno why y'all hate this game / blizzard, it's WAAAY BETTER game than tf2, also I dunno why it is on steam. Tbh I don't care, I just like this game

Despite the review bombing that is currently taking place under this new title, the game itself is really fun. 

Of course there is the glaring issues and failed PR from blizzard but the steps are being taken to deliver now by a different producer(Microsoft) instead of (blizzy activision.) 

Hopefully this is a new age for Overwatch, I have played since 2017 through thick and thin. I've quit a few times and even recently burned out for a few months but always come back. The game at it's core is still fun through and through.

Biggest cash grab i've seen im going to fucking explode all the game devs thats on god

O jogo era muito bom porÃ©m a Blizzard negligenciou ele para criar a continuaÃ§Ã£o que falaram que iriam melhorar as coisas e trazer um modo pve. Infelizmente Ã© a Blizzard entÃ£o nÃ£o tivemos os updates que prometeram e o jogo piorou.

Played for years, simply the best shooter in the market right now, people will complain about monetisation but the game is the same as any other free to play game, you gotta pay for some skins, and I repeat SOME, playing purely for free you'll get more cosmetics than you ever could playing shooters like Valo or CSGO. No other game has the same level of polish, complexity and hero diversity like Overwatch. Balance is good, any hero is viable at any rank, the only tough part is starting out, the skill floor for the game can be pretty unforgiving at times, but once you get over that hurdle, there's simply nothing like it.

The Biggest Fumble in gaming since battlefront 2, they gave zero content and zero balance changes for 3 years with the promise of a dope PVE gamemode coming they changed the monetization to be even more predatory and scummy, then cancelled the PVE now they are launching it on steam, jeff kaplan left and bobby kotick is a garbage little pig boy
Fun game. I think I have 1000 hours in it but don't remember. Glad to see it on Steam.

Installed this game just to verify its authenticity. And yep, they completely ripped of "Famous" characters from Rule34 and even gave them cloths, disregarding the original lore. My disappointment is immeasurable.
its good, ig i'll finally be able to play somethin that isnt TF2 for a long while now, and thats a good fresh air

This is not the game you are looking for.

You will turn away from the page and install Team Fortress 2.

I've been playing Overwatch since it's 2016 Open Beta and after over 7 years I'm still having fun with this.
Of course there were some missteps, but the game still is the dumb fun with friends we know and love.
We still get new content, Maps, Characters and the amazing in-game Events still cycle through with more modes added every time.
Free to play changed the progression system, sure. But they gotta make money somehow and skins are only optional to begin with.
Legacy players got to keep all their stuff plus all their credits which they can still use to buy the new skins for free.
I had mixed feelings at the beginning. But at the end of the day free to play got more of my friends into the game. Worth it.
There's no pay to win and everyone plays under the same criteria. Cross-Play and Cross-Progression are also a huge bonus.
I'm very pleased with the Steam release. If you never played this before, ignore the review bombing and enjoy.
Bobby Codicks completely destroyed Blizzard.Due to a lack of commercial credit,Blizzard  will find it difficult to return to the Chinese market.

Overwatch 1.5
The changes from the first game for the second made the game, somehow, worse
Having a single player campaign behind a paywall is mocking the buyers from the first game
Plenty of problems with this one
